extra

Class Protocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • extra.Protocol

  • public class Protocol
extends java.lang.Object
    https://gitlab.com/arthurrump/ringgz.protocol This class contains constants for all keywords/commands used in the protocol and static methods to create all commands with their arguments. The constants and methods are tagged with [SERVER] or [CLIENT] to indicate which type of program can send that message. Messages that are part of an extension are tagged with [EXT (extension name)].
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Arthur Rump

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Protocol.Extension
      The extensions in the protocol.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String challenge(java.lang.String[] usernames)
      [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] A request to challenge players for a game, supplying a list of 1 to 3 usernames to challenge.
      static java.lang.String challengeDenied()
      [EXT CHALLENGE][SERVER] Message send to all players in a challenge when one of the challenged players has denied the challenge.
      static java.lang.String chat(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String message)
      [EXT CHAT][SERVER] A chat message to send to all players of a game.

      [EXT LEADERBOARD][CLIENT] Request the leaderboard from the server.

      [SERVER] Indicate that the received move was not a valid one.

      [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] Indicate that you deny the challenge.

      [EXT LEADERBOARD][SERVER] A message containing the leaderboard as pairs of usernames and scores.

      static java.lang.String requestPlayers()
      [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] Request a list of players that can be challenged for playing a game.
      static java.lang.String sendChat(java.lang.String message)
      [EXT CHAT][CLIENT] Request to send a chat message to all other players of the game you're participating in.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static java.lang.String login(java.lang.String username,
                                     Protocol.Extension[] extensions)
        [CLIENT] Indicate that a computer wants to join the server to play a game, supporting some extensions.
        Parameters:
        username - the username the player wants to use, containing only letters and numbers
        extensions - extensions the client supports

      • loginFail

        public static java.lang.String loginFail(int errorCode)
        [SERVER] Indicate that the login failed, supplying the reason as an error code.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - a code indicating why the login failed, see docs/general for a list of codes

      • loginOk

        public static java.lang.String loginOk(Protocol.Extension[] extensions)
        [SERVER] Indicate that the login was successful, supplying extensions that are supported on the server.
        Parameters:
        extensions - extensions the server supports

      • makeGame

        public static java.lang.String makeGame(int numberOfPlayers)
        [CLIENT] Request to start a game, indicating the number of players you want to play with.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPlayers - the number of players in the game, should be 2, 3 or 4

      • gameStarted

        public static java.lang.String gameStarted(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> usersWithColors)
        [SERVER] Indicate that a game has started, supplying the players of the game and with which colors they play.
        Parameters:
        usersWithColors - a map with as key the username of the player, and as the value a list of colors they play with. See docs/general for the coding of colors

      • makeMove

        public static java.lang.String makeMove(int boardRow,
                                        int boardColumn,
                                        java.lang.String ringColor,
                                        int ringSize)
        [CLIENT] Indicate the placement of a new ring on the board.
        Parameters:
        boardRow - the row the ring is placed in, with index starting at 0
        boardColumn - the column the ring is placed in, with index starting at 0
        ringColor - the color of the ring, see docs/general for the coding of colors
        ringSize - the size of the ring, see docs/general for the coding of sizes

      • invalidMove

        public static java.lang.String invalidMove()
        [SERVER] Indicate that the received move was not a valid one.

      • moveMade

        public static java.lang.String moveMade(int boardRow,
                                        int boardColumn,
                                        java.lang.String ringColor,
                                        int ringSize)
        [SERVER] Broadcast a move made by a player to the other clients, so they can update their internal gamestate.
        Parameters:
        boardRow - the row the ring is placed in, with index starting at 0
        boardColumn - the column the ring is placed in, with index starting at 0
        ringColor - the color of the ring, see docs/general for the coding of colors
        ringSize - the size of the ring, see docs/general for the coding of sizes

      • nextPlayer

        public static java.lang.String nextPlayer(java.lang.String username)
        [SERVER] Indicate which player is expected to make a move next. A player could be skipped in the case that there are no valid moves to be made by them.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the next player

      • gameOverWinner

        public static java.lang.String gameOverWinner(java.lang.String username)
        [SERVER] Indicate that the game is finished and that there's a winner.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the winner

      • gameOverDraw

        public static java.lang.String gameOverDraw()
        [SERVER] Indicate that the game is finished and it's a draw.

      • requestPlayers

        public static java.lang.String requestPlayers()
        [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] Request a list of players that can be challenged for playing a game.

      • players

        public static final java.lang.String players(java.lang.String[] usernames)
        [EXT CHALLENGE][SERVER] The response to a request for a list of players, containing a list of usernames of players on the server that also support the challenge extension.
        Parameters:
        usernames - a list of usernames of challenge supporting players on the server

      • challenge

        public static java.lang.String challenge(java.lang.String[] usernames)
        [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] A request to challenge players for a game, supplying a list of 1 to 3 usernames to challenge.
        Parameters:
        usernames - the usernames of the players you want to challenge

      • invite

        public static java.lang.String invite(java.lang.String[] usernames)
        [EXT CHALLENGE][SERVER] A message send to players that are being challenged, listing all participants in the game.
        Parameters:
        usernames - the usernames of all players that are challenged for the game

      • inviteAccepted

        public static java.lang.String inviteAccepted()
        [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] Indicate that you accept the challenge.

      • inviteDenied

        public static java.lang.String inviteDenied()
        [EXT CHALLENGE][CLIENT] Indicate that you deny the challenge.

      • challengeDenied

        public static java.lang.String challengeDenied()
        [EXT CHALLENGE][SERVER] Message send to all players in a challenge when one of the challenged players has denied the challenge.

      • getLeaderboard

        public static java.lang.String getLeaderboard()
        [EXT LEADERBOARD][CLIENT] Request the leaderboard from the server.

      • leaderboard

        public static java.lang.String leaderboard(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> usernamesWithScores)
        [EXT LEADERBOARD][SERVER] A message containing the leaderboard as pairs of usernames and scores. Send to a client as response to the get-leaderboard message.
        Parameters:
        usernamesWithScores - a map with usernames as keys and scores as values

      • sendChat

        public static java.lang.String sendChat(java.lang.String message)
        [EXT CHAT][CLIENT] Request to send a chat message to all other players of the game you're participating in.
        Parameters:
        message - the message you want to send

      • chat

        public static java.lang.String chat(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String message)
        [EXT CHAT][SERVER] A chat message to send to all players of a game.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the sender of the message
        message - the chat message
